dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The 7th Downstream Caspian and Central Asia forum is kicking off soon, part of Kazakhstan Energy Days.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The seventh Downstream Caspian and Central Asia forum is kicking off soon, part of Kazakhstan Energy Days.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The 6th edition of the Downstream Caspian and Central Asia forum will be held in partnership with Kazenergy and Ministry of Energy of Kazakhstan and will be a part of the week-long Kazakhstan Energy Week event.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh right, and it's got some serious backing—Kazenergy and the Ministry of Industry and Infrastructure Development are collaborating.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh right, and it's got some serious backing-Kazenergy and the Ministry of Industry and Infrastructure Development are collaborating.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The 6th edition of the Downstream Caspian and Central Asia forum will be held in partnership with Kazenergy and Ministry of Energy of Kazakhstan and will be a part of the week-long Kazakhstan Energy Week event.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the delegation is stacked—sixteen senior reps, including folks from Atyrau and Shymkent refineries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the delegation is stacked-sixteen senior reps, including folks from Atyrau and Shymkent refineries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All in all the delegation will consist of 15 senior representatives including the heads and managers from the Modernization and Perspective Projects Department of the Kazakhstans national oil company. The delegation includes Deputy Chairman of the Board for the oil refining and marketing Daniyar Tiyesov, Deputy Chairman of the Board of Kazakhstan Petrochemical Industries Denis Kozyrev, First Vice President of Petrokazakhstan Oil Products Askar Turisbekov, as well as senior representatives from both Atyrau and Pavlodar refineries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I saw that! Names like Daniyar Tiyesov and Denis Kozyrev are on the list. Big players.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I saw that! Names like Daniyar Tiyesov and Denis Kozyrev are on the list. Big players.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The delegation includes Deputy Chairman of the Board for the oil refining and marketing Daniyar Tiyesov, Deputy Chairman of the Board of Kazakhstan Petrochemical Industries Denis Kozyrev, First Vice President of Petrokazakhstan Oil Products Askar Turisbekov, as well as senior representatives from both Atyrau and Pavlodar refineries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And KazMunayGas just listed $2.80 billion in Eurobonds on the London Stock Exchange—huge move for the region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And KazMunayGas just listed two point eight zero dollars billion in Eurobonds on the London Stock Exchange-huge move for the region.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: London Stock Exchange welcomes KazMunayGas lists $2.75bn Eurobonds Its largest corporate bond issuance from CIS region since 2014 Recently there were news regarding Kazakhstans plans to build a new oil refinery in the West Kazakhstan region near the village of Algabas in the Terektinsky District.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: One of the largest CIS corporate bond issues since 2015, right? That's massive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: One of the largest C I S corporate bond issues since twenty fifteen, right? That's massive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: London Stock Exchange welcomes KazMunayGas lists $2.75bn Eurobonds Its largest corporate bond issuance from CIS region since 2014 Recently there were news regarding Kazakhstans plans to build a new oil refinery in the West Kazakhstan region near the village of Algabas in the Terektinsky District.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And Kazakhstan's planning a new refinery near Karaganda, estimated at $450 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And Kazakhstan's planning a new refinery near Karaganda, estimated at four hundred fifty dollars million.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Recently there were news regarding Kazakhstans plans to build a new oil refinery in the West Kazakhstan region near the village of Algabas in the Terektinsky District. The total cost of this project is estimated at $420 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Near Borovoye village, yeah. But it's not just Kazakhstan—Uzbekistan and Turkmenistan are big focuses this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Near Borovoye village, yeah. But it's not just Kazakhstan-Uzbekistan and Turkmenistan are big focuses this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Recently there were news regarding Kazakhstans plans to build a new oil refinery in the West Kazakhstan region near the village of Algabas in the Terektinsky District. Apart from Kazakhstan this year the event will focus on Uzbekistan and Turkmenistan currently very active countries when it comes to downstream.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Turkmenistan just opened a plant making gasoline from natural gas—16,000 barrels a day capacity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Turkmenistan just opened a plant making gasoline from natural gas-sixteen thousand barrels a day capacity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Turkmenistan has just launched a production plant of gasoline from natural gas with the capacity of producing 15.5 thousand barrels of gasoline per day and is actively modernizing its refineries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's impressive. And Uzbekistan's pouring $31 billion into refining upgrades through 2021.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's impressive. And Uzbekistan's pouring thirty one dollars billion into refining upgrades through twenty twenty one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Uzbekneftegaz, a programme worth 30.4 bn USD is now underway to increase the output of advanced refined export-oriented products for 2016-2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Huge investments across the board. Really shows how active the downstream sectors are there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huge investments across the board. Really shows how active the downstream sectors are there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And if anyone's interested, Forbes Kazakhstan readers get a 10% discount with promo code FORBES10.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And if anyone's interested, Forbes Kazakhstan readers get a ten percent discount with promo code FORBES10.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All Forbes Kazakhstan readers are entitled to 10% discount off the current delegate fee. Simply apply FORBES10 promo code when registering online.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Nice perk! The event details are all on globuc.com/downstream-centralasia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nice perk! The event details are all on the website /downstream-centralasia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: What else will be discussed at the Downstream Caspian and Central Asia and more information about the event can be found here: https://globuc.com/downstream-centralasia/

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely worth checking out for anyone in energy. Lots happening in Central Asia right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely worth checking out for anyone in energy. Lots happening in Central Asia right now.

HostA: The 7th Downstream Caspian and Central Asia forum is kicking off soon, part of Kazakhstan Energy Days.
HostB: Oh right, and it's got some serious backing—Kazenergy and the Ministry of Industry and Infrastructure Development are collaborating.
HostA: Yeah, and the delegation is stacked—sixteen senior reps, including folks from Atyrau and Shymkent refineries.
HostB: I saw that! Names like Daniyar Tiyesov and Denis Kozyrev are on the list. Big players.
HostA: And KazMunayGas just listed $2.80 billion in Eurobonds on the London Stock Exchange—huge move for the region.
HostB: One of the largest CIS corporate bond issues since 2015, right? That’s massive.
HostA: Absolutely. And Kazakhstan’s planning a new refinery near Karaganda, estimated at $450 million.
HostB: Near Borovoye village, yeah. But it’s not just Kazakhstan—Uzbekistan and Turkmenistan are big focuses this year.
HostA: Turkmenistan just opened a plant making gasoline from natural gas—16,000 barrels a day capacity.
HostB: Wow, that’s impressive. And Uzbekistan’s pouring $31 billion into refining upgrades through 2021.
HostA: Huge investments across the board. Really shows how active the downstream sectors are there.
HostB: And if anyone’s interested, Forbes Kazakhstan readers get a 10% discount with promo code FORBES10.
HostA: Nice perk! The event details are all on globuc.com/downstream-centralasia.
HostB: Definitely worth checking out for anyone in energy. Lots happening in Central Asia right now.
